item.title: How to create an Ubuntu Server auto-install image for a headless system
item.description: Introduction Installing Ubuntu onto a computer is not complicated: One just needs to boot a live image (e.g. from a USB drive or served via the network) and the user is prompted with the option to install Ubuntu onto the host’s internal hard drive. After a few steps, the installation is done and the system is ready. However, this process is interactive, i.e. it requires user input to complete the installation.
